args:
Yachiyo is suspicious of Saiga, who somehow
seems different from the man she once knew.
After she assists him in fighting off a horde of
the undead, a man from the Mukuroshu tells
her that Saiga is actually the one responsible
for her beloved grandpappy's murder.
Saiga was the hubby of my big sister,\nMomoyo, which made him my\nbrother-in-law.
And he was also a senior disciple\nof my grandpappy.
Er, but I didn't see him using a blade...

Yep, this is the first time I've seen him
chuck around projectiles—and that ain't
the only difference. He's like a whole new
cat now.
What was he like when you knew him?
Righteous to the end—a real square draw.\nHe hated liars and crooks, and prioritized\ndecorum above everything.
And he was kind, especially with my\nsister. The pair of 'em were always gettin'\nthe giggles about one thing or another.
He doesn't strike me as much of a giggler.
He changed after my sister died.
Everybody could see how much those\ntwo lovebirds cared for each other...

But after she took sick and sashayed into
the great beyond, he grew despondent.
And one day, he up and took a powder
without so much as a see-ya-later.
And you have no idea where he went\nor what he was doing all that time?

Nope. And sure, I was worried about him,
but then my grandpappy joined my sister
at the pearly gates and my own journey
became my focus.
Your journey to duel a thousand warriors\nand become the strongest fighter ever.
Bingo. Getting that kind of muscle was\nalways my grandpappy's fondest wish.

It's kind of my way of mourning him,
what with his being bumped off and all.
I want to make his dream come true
since he never could.
Bumped off? Wait, does that mean—
Don't take all the fun for yourself!\nLet me dip my beak!
I did not expect you to offer me aid.\nDoes this mean you have finally decided\nto relinquish the scroll?
My mind ain't been changed between the\nlast time I saw you and now, pal.
If you really want me to trust you, you can\nstart by spilling your guts about what you\ngot up to after you split town.
Clamming up, eh? Well, that dumb show\nain't gonna get us nowhere.
Then permit me to step in and move\nmatters along in his stead.
It has been an age, Saiga, yet I never\nbelieved we might be reunited here.
Oh, it is much more than that...\nSaiga is one of our sacred brethren—\na member of the Mukuroshu!
So THAT'S how he knows so much\nabout the Underworld Key!
Wait, hang on. But that means the reason\nhe keeps asking Yachiyo for the scroll is—
You never did have a sense of humor.\nHraaaagh!
He used a corpse as a shield!
This man is a necromancer who controls\nthe undead. Unless you lay him low,\nthis battle will rage without end.
Are you our ally here, Saiga?

I am no one's ally. Rather, I am naught but
a miserable man mired in a delusion.
However, any relationship I may have held
with their group has since been severed.
Ah, but it wounds me to hear you be so\nuncongenial when we have buried\ncountless enemies together.
Be silent! I am done with the Mukuroshu.\nFind another tool to wield.
Are you still fretting over that last\nfeeble old geezer you killed?
If I'm not mistaken, he was your teacher\nin the ways of the sword, yes?
Ah, the troublesome woman with the\nUnderworld Key scroll! You were that\nold man's granddaughter, yes?
It seems Saiga told you nothing of this—\nthough I imagine it WOULD be difficult to\nlay bare such fell and wicked deeds.
So let me reveal them in his stead:\nIt was he who cut down your beloved\ngrandfather in cold blood!
I told you to be silent, you baseless cur!
Is...is that true, Saiga?\nDid you kill Grandpappy?
Don't you dare give me the high hat,\nSaiga! I want the damn truth NOW!

Oh ho! How frightful! I fear I may
have awakened the sleeping dragon.
Well then, best for me to step away
and let the two of you work things out.
You think we'll just let you walk away?!

Yes, actually. Oh, but don't worry; I shall
leave a suitable group behind in my place.
You may indulge in these entertainments
to your heart's content!
Silent bones, mouldering beneath the\nearth...walk this land once more!
Gya! I can't get a clear shot at the guy\nwith all these damn corpses in the way!
Oh, and Saiga? The Mukuroshu stands\nready to welcome your return with open\narms whenever you are ready.
Surely your ultimate goal can be more\neasily achieved at our side, no?
Oh, but when you do come crawling back,\nmake sure to gift us with the location of\nthe Underworld Key! Aaaah ha ha ha ha!
There can be no benefit to my returning\nto you pack of jackals!
